lines.text: John, when you're kissing me, don't talk about plumbing.
What? Oh, I'm sorry, what should I talk about?
Well, do you have to talk?
Don't you come near me, you seawolf, after the way you deceived me...
I deceived you?
Yes! You're engaged!
You're married!
That has nothing to do with it!
[repeated line]
Catastroph!

[telling Liz that he isn't engaged anymore]
She married my shipmate.
She did!
I'm as free as a bird!
Oh, that's what you think.
[she kisses him]
Everytime I'd opened my mouth he talked. I felt like Charlie McCarthy.
Sam?
Yes, sir?
Catastrophe, what is it?
It's from the Greek. It means "a misfortune, a cataclysm or a serious calamity."
It is good?
No, sir. That's bad.
[repeated line]
Everything is hunky-dunky!

[Getting fed up with Mr. Yardley, who won't let her speak]
Suppose you listen to me for a change?... I said listen to me! I'm tired of being pushed around. Tired of being told what to do. Tired of writing your god-darned articles. Tired of dancing to everybody else's tune. Tired of being told whom to marry. In short... I'm tired!

[Elizabeth's baby needs medical attention]
I don't want anything to happen to that baby. It will ruin my circulation.
It won't do the baby no good, neither.
That coat! What's the meaning?
Don't worry, I'm paying for it myself. It'll take my next six months' salary. Nice, isn't it?
Six months' work for a coat?
All my life I promised myself a mink coat. You know, Felix, it's very important to keep promises, especially to yourself.
Do you have to promise so expensively?
But I need it!
You need it? Nobody needs a mink coat but a mink.
Maybe scarlet fever. It's a better color for Christmas.
[last lines]
What a Christmas! Ho, ho, what a Christmas!
Liz, don't waste time with him. You have to decide what you're going to say to the old man.
What old man?
Oh, it's Yardley. He's sending me a sailor for Christmas.
Oh, how nice... A sailor? Really, Elizabeth!
The things a girl will do for a mink coat.
I had a silk hat when I was in Budapest. It made me feel so fine, but then I got fired with a silk hat.
Watch now. I show you how to flip-flop the flop-flips.

[Dudley has told her she has to go to see Yardley to arrange her Christmas with the sailor]
Arrange it, are you crazy? Where am I gonna get a farm? I haven't even got a window box!

[Jefferson Jones arrives in the middle of Liz and John's wedding]
Oh no, John! It's the sailor! He's two hours early! What'll I do!
Good morning; Merry Christmas. I hope I'm in time to see you flip the flapjacks.
Why, that's strange. He looks different this morning.
Wouldn't you look different if you'd swallowed a watch?
But he's a blonde, has teeth, and he talks.
Mr. Yardley, this is no time to take inventory!
Having babies to boost your circulation takes time.
I suppose you'll give the bride away, Uncle Felix?
Me? I don't give nobody away. Always I keep my mouth shut.
